channel.title: Compiling Question
channel.description:
I just downloaded a new source, but when I ruserver I get the "The system cannot find the path specified". Then inside the runserver.bat there's this: [code]"C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m -classpath build;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar net.com.codeusa.Server 43594[/code]
Is there an alternative to running this ?

item.title: Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @tarheels tarheels
item.description:
@tarheels wrote:

That worked Sadly, when something work’s something else goes wrong.

I ran the client, which said loading sprites… then I got the js5connect error.
It’s a 525 server btw.(Mast3r-pkyz)

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @tarheels tarheels
item.description:
@tarheels wrote:

Well I don’y have administrative access and I cant update JRE and for some reason a RUNDLL error comes up from my firewall. I looked, and found out that my firewall setting are blocking Java runtime. Ive tried to change the jre1.6.0_15 to jdk1.6_24 but it still says cannot find path. But the other compiler that i Use:

@echo off title rs2hd compiler echo Preparing... mkdir bin cd src copy log4j.xml .. cd .. move log4j.xml bin/ echo Compiling core... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac" -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/Main.java echo completed... echo running server... title Server. java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main pause

That work’s perfectly but then I have this:

@echo off title Mast3r-pkyz 525 - ace "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m -classpath build;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar net.com.codeusa.Server 43594 pause

Which doesn’t work. I just want to see if it’s possible to direct it to JDK instead of JRE.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @tarheels tarheels
item.description:
@tarheels wrote:

Both is there a way to make it run with JDK instead of JRE?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“tarheels, post:4, topic:389336”]I just fixed it Thank you for your quick help too Good luck for you 10,000th post.
Btw the folder name of my JRE was JRE1.6.0_15 lol.[/quote]

I’m assuming this is for Vain, but if it’s directed at me,
Thanks :3

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tarheels tarheels
item.description:

item.title: Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Go To your C:\ drive
Go To Program Files
Look for Java
Edit the Highlighted Blue text in I Vain I’s Last post, with your Version of Java
For example, Mine is: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe

Also, From your Previous Posts, i noticed that your Not a 64 Bit OS.
That code might work for you, you just need to change the JDK Version

( If you can’t find it at all, then go download from Oracle. )

EDIT: If you Still need help, PM me

Read full topic
